alert.note: Alert for Howard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 04 at 3:19PM CDT until April 04 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Howard County in central Missouri... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 319 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Rocheport, or 7 miles northeast of Boonville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Howard County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
